overview: GitHub has extended the deadline for self-hosted runner minimum version enforcement by one week. Self-hosted runners must be upgraded to v2.329.0 or later by March 16, 2026, with a brownout period running from February 16 to March 16.

detailed_explanation.title: Timeline extension
bullets: The configuration-time version enforcement deadline has been extended by one week to March 16, 2026.
This extends the timeline originally shared in the December 2025 announcement.

detailed_explanation.title: Enforcement details
bullets: Starting March 16, 2026, GitHub Actions will block configurations from runners older than v2.329.0 (released October 15, 2025).
After enforcement, older runners will not be able to connect or self-upgrade after running the configuration script.

detailed_explanation.title: Brownout schedule
bullets: Between February 16 and March 16, scheduled configuration blocks will occur to help identify runners needing updates.
Brownout windows escalate from 1-hour blocks in week 1 to multi-hour blocks in weeks 2-3, then continuous from March 9.
Times are provided across UTC, US Pacific, US Eastern, Central Europe, India, Japan/Korea, and Australia East.

detailed_explanation.title: Required actions
bullets: Download the latest runner release from the Actions Runner releases page.
Update installation scripts, images, or automation to install v2.329.0 or later before running ./config.sh.
Recreate or redeploy runners built from images or templates containing older versions.

key_changes: Minimum version enforcement deadline extended by one week to March 16, 2026.

Full enforcement begins March 16, 2026: runners below v2.329.0 permanently blocked.
Minimum required version is v2.329.0 (released October 15, 2025).
impact: All organizations using self-hosted runners must ensure runners are at v2.329.0 or later by March 16, 2026.
CI/CD pipelines using older runner versions will experience temporary blocks during the brownout period.
Teams with runner images baked into templates or automation need to rebuild with the updated version.
caveats: The one-week extension is the only change; the minimum version requirement (v2.329.0) remains the same.
Brownout blocks are scheduled and will affect runners below the minimum version even before full enforcement.
After March 16, older runners cannot self-upgrade via the configuration script; they must be manually updated first.
insights: The extension suggests that a significant number of organizations had not yet upgraded, prompting GitHub to provide additional time.
The escalating brownout schedule is designed to create urgency progressively, giving teams early warning signals.
Organizations should treat the brownout blocks as dry runs to identify all runners that still need upgrading.
